div.l: His purpose was to bystowe her heye
Vnto some worthy blode of Auncetrye
For holy chirche gode motte bene dispendede
On holy chiche þat is descendede
Therefor he wolde his holy blode honoure
Though þat holy chirche schulde deuoure
Grete soken haþe this Myller owte of dowte
With whete ⁊and Malte of all the lande abowte
And namelyche þ̉er was A grete Collayge
Men clepeþe the solar halle atte Cambrygge
There was her whete ⁊and eke her Mallte
And on A daye hitt happede in A stounde
Syke lay the Manciple on A Malladye
Men wenden wysselye that he schulde deye
For whiche this Myller stale boþe Mele ⁊and corne
An hunderde tyme More þan biforne
For þ̉er biforne he stale butte Curtayslye
Butte now he was A theefe outerageouslye
For whiche þe wardeyn chydde ⁊and made Fare
Butte therbye sette þe Myller noughte A tare
He crakede boste And swore itt was nottte so
Than were þ̉er yonge scollers two
That dwelten in the halle of whiche I saye
Testyfe they were And lustye For to playe
And onelye For her Myrþe ⁊and reuerye
Vppon the wardeyn besyly they crye
To yeue hym leue butte A litulle stounde
To gone to Mylle And seene her corne grounde
And hardelye they durste laye her necke
The Myller schuld notte stele hem halfe A pecke
Of corne ne by sleyghte ne by Force hem reue
And atte the last the wardeyn yafe hem leue
Iohn hyghte þat oone ⁊and Aleyn hyghte þat other
Of oone Towne were they borne þat hyghte Stroþer
